Welcome to mnc_python’s documentation!¶

mnc.common.CHAN_BW = 23925.78125¶

Channel bandwidth coming out of the F-Engine

mnc.common.CLOCK = 196000000.0¶

Sample rate for the ADCs

mnc.common.ETCD_HOST = 'etcdv3service'¶

etcd hostname - can be overridden with a ‘ETCD_HOST = …’ line in ‘etcd.cfg’ file

mnc.common.ETCD_PORT = 2379¶

etcd port - can be overridden with a ‘ETCD_PORT = …’ line in ‘etcd.cfg’ file

mnc.common.FS = 196000000.0¶

Sample rate that is the basis for LWA time tags

class mnc.common.LWATime(val, val2=None, format=None, scale=None, precision=None, in_subfmt=None, out_subfmt=None, location=None, copy=False)[source]¶

Subclass of astropy.time.Time that accept a LWA timetag as an input. It also attributes for accessing a (seconds, fraction seconds) tuple (“tuple”) and a LWA timetag (“timetag”).

property casa_epoch¶

Return a two element tuple of (CASA time reference, CASA time string) that is suitable for use with casacore.measures.measures.epoch.

property measurementset¶

Returns a time value of MJD seconds that is compatible with how time is stored in a measurement set.

property timetag¶

Return a LWA timetag (ticks of a FS clock since the unix epoch).

property tuple¶

Return a (seconds, fractional seconds) tuple.

class mnc.common.LogFileHandler(filename, rollover_callback=None)[source]¶

Sub-class of TimedRotatingFileHandler that rolls over files daily and keeps the last 21 days.

doRollover()[source]¶

do a rollover; in this case, a date/time stamp is appended to the filename when the rollover happens. However, you want the file to be named for the start of the interval, not the current time. If there is a backup count, then we have to get a list of matching filenames, sort them and remove the one with the oldest suffix.

mnc.common.NCHAN = 4096¶

Total number of channels computed by the F-engine

mnc.common.NPIPELINE = 32¶

Total number of GPU pipelines

mnc.common.OVRO_EPOCH = datetime.datetime(1970, 1, 1, 0, 0)¶

Epoch that is the basis for LWA time tags

mnc.common.chan_to_freq(chan)[source]¶

Convert a channel number to a frequency in Hz.

mnc.common.daemonize(stdin='/dev/null', stdout='/dev/null', stderr='/dev/null')[source]¶

This forks the current process into a daemon. The stdin, stdout, and stderr arguments are file names that will be opened and be used to replace the standard file descriptors in sys.stdin, sys.stdout, and sys.stderr. These arguments are optional and default to /dev/null. Note that stderr is opened unbuffered, so if it shares a file with stdout then interleaved output may not appear in the order that you expect.

mnc.common.freq_to_chan(freq)[source]¶

Convert a frequency in Hz to a channel number.

mnc.common.quota_size(value)[source]¶

Covnert a human readable quota size into a number of bytes.

mnc.common.setup_signal_handling(threads, log=None, signals=[<Signals.SIGHUP: 1>, <Signals.SIGINT: 2>, <Signals.SIGQUIT: 3>, <Signals.SIGTERM: 15>, <Signals.SIGTSTP: 18>])[source]¶

Setup signal handling for a Bifrost pipeline given a list of block threads. This catches a collection of signals and then calls the shutdown method of the first thread.

mnc.common.synchronize_time(server='ntp.ubuntu.com')[source]¶

Call ntpdate with the specified NTP server to update the system time. Returns a Boolean of whether or not the operation was successful.
